p: There was a significant ( p ≤ 0.001) augmented serum expressions of inflammatory markers including TNF- α, IL-1 β, IL-6, caspase-3, NO, and PGE-2 in diabetic-untreated animals as compared with the nondiabetic group. L. regularis treatment in 150 mg/kg dose significantly decreased the serum expressions of TNF- α ( p ≤ 0.01), IL-1 β ( p ≤ 0.01), IL-6 ( p ≤ 0.05), and NO ( p ≤ 0.05) as compared with the STZ group. The higher L. regularis dose (300 mg/kg) significantly reduced the serum expressions of TNF- α ( p ≤ 0.001), IL-1 β ( p ≤ 0.001), IL-6 ( p ≤ 0.01), caspase-3 ( p ≤ 0.01), NO ( p ≤ 0.01), and PGE-2 ( p ≤ 0.05) in diabetic rats as compared with the STZ group ( Figure 2).
